fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Get and install KS from 2_0_X branch
2. Go to Phone > Camera > Camera Basic
3. Take picture and press OK 

May need to repeat step 3 a couple of times.

Actual: The taken picture does not appear on screen and get OutOfMemoryError exception in logcat. See attachment.
Expected: Should not get OutOfMemoryError exception and should see taken picture.

Note:
* This does not occur in 1.8.2
* Tested only on v8. Did not test on rhino.
fields.summary: Android: Camera - On V8, taking a picture at least twice causes an OutOfMemoryError exception
fields.environment:
SDK build: 2.0.0.v20120328183230
Runtime: v8
Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.0.201203291340
Device: HTC Amaze 4G (2.3.4)

comments.body: Failure also occurs under Rhino.  Seems related to TiComposite changes and a possible bug in the KS test case that requires updating.

Closing as Fixed.

SDK: 2.0.1.v20120405211737, 2.1.0.v20120406133501
Android: V8
Studio: 2.0.1.201204051443
OS: Snow Leopard
Devices Tested: Nexus One 2.2.2, Amaze 2.3.4, Galaxy Nexus 4.0.2

Took 10 pictures for each device/SDK without issue.

Reopening to update labels.

Note to QE: Test is already in KS.
